marketNews.title: Indonesia Economy Slows to +4.95% YoY in Q3 2024
marketNews.content:
Indonesia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) grew +1.5% quarter-on-quarter and +4.95% year-on-year in the third quarter of 2024 (versus Q2 2024: +5.05% YoY), lower than the consensus expectations of +1.6% QoQ and +5% YoY. This result marks the slowest annual economic growth since Q3 2023 and brings the 9-month (9M24) growth to only +5.03% YoY, below the government target of +5.2% YoY.

On the expenditure side, domestic consumption – which contributed 2.55 percentage points to annual economic growth in Q3 2024 – weakened slightly to +4.91% YoY (versus Q2 2024: +4.93% YoY).

Exports (+9.09% YoY versus Q2 2024: +8.28% YoY) grew at a lower pace than imports (+11.47% YoY versus Q2 2024: +7.79% YoY), causing net exports to contribute a negative 0.08 percentage points to annual growth in Q3 2024.

Government spending (+4.62% YoY versus Q2 2024: +1.42% YoY) and gross fixed capital formation (+5.15% YoY versus Q2 2024: +4.43% YoY) both accelerated in Q3 2024, contributing 0.32 and 1.63 percentage points respectively to annual growth.

Spatially, the weaker growth was driven by the islands of Java and Sumatra, where growth rates were only +4.92% YoY and +4.48% YoY respectively in Q3 2024, far below the rates in Maluku and Papua (+6% YoY), Sulawesi (+5.87% YoY), Bali and Nusa Tenggara (+5.28% YoY), and Kalimantan (+5.2% YoY).

The GDP release came only a few days after the BPS announced that Indonesia's consumer price index (CPI) inflation slowed to 1.71% in October 2024 (versus September 2024: 1.84% YoY), the lowest level since October 2021.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The weak inflation trend and economic growth that fell short of expectations may indicate a weakening of consumer purchasing power, leading to a down-trading phenomenon as we wrote in Stockbit Snips. This phenomenon can be a positive catalyst for consumer-oriented issuers that position their products in the "value" segment, such as Tempo Scan Pacific ($TSPC). We have also released an Unboxing of TSPC that you can read here.\n\nNevertheless, we observe a shift in the drivers of growth from Java and Sumatra to other islands. This trend is also visible in retail issuers – such as $ACES (as we wrote here) and $MIDI – which are experiencing more significant growth outside Java, and their future strategies are expected to become more expansionary beyond Java.

tickerNews.title: ADRO announces additional dividend of Rp1,349 per share
tickerNews.content: $ADRO: Adaro Energy Indonesia announced that there are two agenda items in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 18 November 2024: (1) distribution of an additional dividend for fiscal year 2023 amounting to 2.6 billion USD, equivalent to approximately Rp1,349 per share assuming an exchange rate of 15,778 IDR per USD; and (2) a corporate name change to introduce a new identity. Based on ADRO's closing price on Monday (4/11) at Rp3,930 per share, this dividend implies a dividend yield of up to 34.3%. The corporate action is part of a spin-off of ADRO's thermal coal subsidiary, PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AAI).

tickerNews.title: MEDC targets 2025 oil and gas production of 145-150 MBOEPD
tickerNews.content: $MEDC: Medco Energi International reported that it targets oil and gas production of 145-150 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day (MBOEPD) in 2025 (versus the 2024 target of 145 MBOEPD), lower than the actual 9-month 2024 production of 153 MBOEPD. The 2025 production cost is targeted to stay below USD 10 per BOE, the same as the 2024 target; the actual 9-month 2024 cost was USD 7.7 per BOE. Electricity sales are targeted at 4,500 GWh in 2025 (versus the 2024 target of 4,100 GWh). During 9M24, MEDC realized electricity sales of 2,961 GWh.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia plans to replace Garuda Indonesia CEO
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: Bloomberg reported that the State-Owned Enterprises Ministry plans to replace the President Director of Garuda Indonesia as part of a government effort to improve profitability and support the airline's expansion. Bloomberg sources said the replacement could occur as early as mid-November 2024, with the acting President Director of Lion Air, Wamildan Tsani Panjaitan, and GIAA's Chief Financial Officer, Prasetio, as potential candidates. The ministry has not commented on the issue. Bloomberg also noted that the government intends to increase GIAA's fleet from about 100 aircraft to more than 150 aircraft.

tickerNews.title: TBLA to distribute interim dividend of 35 Rp per share
tickerNews.content: $TBLA: Tunas Baru Lampung will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 211 billion Rupiah or 35 Rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on the regular market and negotiated market on 12 November 2024, with payment on 4 December 2024. Based on TBLA's closing price on Tuesday (5/11) at Rp690 per share, the implied dividend yield is 5.1%.

tickerNews.title: TOTL secures new contract worth 4.4 trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: $TOTL: Total Bangun Persada reported that it has secured a new contract valued at 4.4 trillion Rupiah during the first 10 months of 2024, equivalent to 98% of the 2024 target of 4.5 trillion Rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ISAT provides shareholder loan of 555 billion Rupiah to Starone Mitra Telekomunikasi
tickerNews.content: $ISAT: Indosat, together with its subsidiary PT Aplikanusa Lintasarta, provided a shareholder loan of 555 billion Rupiah to its subsidiary PT Starone Mitra Telekomunikasi. The loan carries an interest rate of 9.25% and is intended to finance capital expenditure. PT Starone Mitra Telekomunikasi is a joint venture in the data-center business owned by ISAT together with BDX Asia Data Center Holdings Pte. Ltd.

tickerNews.title: AVIA to distribute interim dividend of 11 Rp per share
tickerNews.content: $AVIA: Avia Avian will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 673 billion Rupiah or 11 Rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on the regular market and negotiated market on 12 November 2024, with payment on 21 November 2024. Based on AVIA's closing price on Tuesday (5/11) at Rp476 per share, the implied dividend yield is 2.3%.

tickerNews.title: MARK to distribute interim dividend of 20 Rp per share
tickerNews.content: $MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 76 billion Rupiah or 20 Rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on the regular market and negotiated market on 13 November 2024, with payment on 5 December 2024. Based on MARK's closing price on Tuesday (5/11) at Rp1,140 per share, the implied dividend yield is 1.8%.

tickerNews.title: TOTO shares sold by controlling shareholders to meet free-float requirements
tickerNews.content: $TOTO: The controlling shareholders of Toto Indonesia, PT Multifortuna Asindo and PT Suryaparamitra Abadi, sold 12.5 million shares and 2.3 million shares respectively at prices of Rp200 and Rp227 per share on 31 October 2024. The total transaction value was approximately 3.3 billion Rupiah and was intended to satisfy free-float requirements. After the transaction, the ownership of PT Multifortuna Asindo fell from 29.51% to 29.39% and PT Suryaparamitra Abadi fell from 25.05% to 25.03%.

tickerNews.title: HATM purchases bulk carrier for 12.5 million USD
tickerNews.content: $HATM: Habco Trans Maritima announced that it has purchased one bulk-carrier vessel for USD 12.5 million from Indian Ocean Ltd. The acquisition is intended to increase transport capacity and meet commodity shipping market demand.

tickerNews.title: BUDI to distribute interim dividend of 5 Rp per share
tickerNews.content: $BUDI: Budi Starch & Sweetener will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 22.5 billion Rupiah or 5 Rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on the regular market and negotiated market on 12 November 2024, with payment on 4 December 2024. Based on BUDI's closing price on Tuesday (5/11) at Rp228 per share, the implied dividend yield is 2.2%.

tickerNews.title: TSPC highlighted as potential beneficiary of down-trading trend
tickerNews.content: Tempo Scan Pacific ($TSPC) was mentioned as a consumer-oriented issuer that could benefit from the down-trading phenomenon caused by weakening purchasing power. The analysis suggests that companies positioned in the value segment may see positive demand under current conditions.

tickerNews.title: ACES noted for stronger growth outside Java
tickerNews.content: Retail issuer $ACES was cited as an example of a company experiencing more significant growth outside Java, supporting a strategic shift toward expansion beyond the island.

tickerNews.title: MIDI noted for stronger growth outside Java
tickerNews.content: Retail issuer $MIDI was highlighted as another example of a company achieving more pronounced growth outside Java, indicating a strategic move toward broader geographic expansion.
